member.name: P:CasualGodComplex.Galaxies.Spiral.Size
member.summary: Approximate physical size of the galaxy

member.summary: Approximate spacing between clusters

member.summary: Minimum number of arms

member.name: M:CasualGodComplex.RandomExtensions.NormallyDistributedSingles(System.Random,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Generates a sequence of values from a normal distribution, using Box-Muller https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Box%E2%80%93Muller_transform
member.param: A (uniform) random number generator
The standard deviation of the distribution
The mean of the distribution

member.name: M:CasualGodComplex.RandomExtensions.NormallyDistributedSingle(System.Random,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Generates a single value from a normal distribution, using Box-Muller https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Box%E2%80%93Muller_transform
member.param: A (uniform) random number generator
The standard deviation of the distribution
The mean of the distribution

member.name: M:CasualGodComplex.RandomExtensions.NormallyDistributedSingles(System.Random,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Generates a sequence of normal values clamped within min and max
member.remarks: Originally used inverse phi method, but this method, found here: http://arxiv.org/pdf/0907.4010.pdf is significantly faster
member.param: A (uniform) random number generator
The standard deviation of the distribution
The mean of the distribution
The minimum allowed value (does not bias)
The max allowed value (does not bias)
member.returns: A sequence of samples from a normal distribution, clamped to within min and max in an unbiased manner.

member.name: M:CasualGodComplex.RandomExtensions.NormallyDistributedSingle(System.Random,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Generates a single normal value clamped within min and max
member.remarks: Originally used inverse phi method, but this method, found here: http://arxiv.org/pdf/0907.4010.pdf is significantly faster
member.param: A (uniform) random number generator
The standard deviation of the distribution
The mean of the distribution
The minimum allowed value (does not bias)
The max allowed value (does not bias)
member.returns: A single sample from a normal distribution, clamped to within min and max in an unbiased manner.

member.value: Original color sample

members.member: Boilerplate constructor

member.name: M:Litipk.ColorSharp.ColorSpaces.AConvertibleColor.ConvertTo(System.Type)
member.summary: Method that allows conversions passing the type as a parameter.

member.name: M:Litipk.ColorSharp.ColorSpaces.AConvertibleColor.IsInsideColorSpace(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Tells us if the object represents a valid color sample in current color space.

member.summary: Gives us the Correlated Color Temperature associated to the spectrum or color.

member.name: M:Litipk.ColorSharp.ColorSpaces.AConvertibleColor.GetDuv
member.summary: Gives us the distance in the UCS color space between our color point and the nearest planckian locus.

member.summary: Converts the color point to an LMS cones stimulous value.

member.name: T:Litipk.ColorSharp.ColorSpaces.ASimpleColor

member.name: T:Litipk.ColorSharp.ColorSpaces.CIE1960
member.summary: CIE's 1960 UCS Color Space. Also named CIE's 1960 Yuv Color Space.

member.value: U / (U + V + W)

member.value: V / (U + V + W)

member.value: U component of the CIE's 1960 UCS color space.

member.value: V component of the CIE's 1960 UCS color space (also Y in Yuv).

member.value: W component of the CIE's 1960 UCS color space.

member.name: P:Litipk.ColorSharp.ColorSpaces.CIE1960.Y
member.value: Y component of the CIE's 1960 Yuv color space (also V in UCS).

member.summary: Creates a new color sample in the CIE's 1960 UCS color space. This is a convenience constructor to allow minimum information loss in color space conversions, but not recommeneded to construct colors "by hand".

member.value: y component of the CIE's 1931 xyY color space : Y/(X+Y+Z) .

member.value: Y component of the CIE's 1931 xyY color space. The same Y from CIE's 1931 XYZ color space.

Computes the 'sharkin' points.

member.name: T:Litipk.ColorSharp.Illuminants.CIE_A
member.summary: CIE standard illuminant A is intended to represent typical, domestic, tungsten-filament lighting. Its relative spectral power distribution is that of a Planckian radiator at a temperature of approximately 2856 K.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Illuminants.CIE_A.XYZ_Sample
member.value: 'A' expressed as a CIE's 1931 XYZ sample (White Point).

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Illuminants.CIE_A.xyY_Sample
member.value: 'A' expressed as a CIE's 1931 xyY sample (White Point).

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Illuminants.CIE_A.spectrum_Sample
member.value: 'A' expressed in its 'original form', a light spectrum.

member.name: T:Litipk.ColorSharp.Illuminants.CIE_B
member.summary: The CIE Illuminant B is a (deprecated) daylight simulator intended to represent direct noon sunlight with a correlated colour temperature of 4874 K.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Illuminants.CIE_B.spectrum_Sample
member.value: 'B' expressed in its 'original form', a light spectrum.

member.name: T:Litipk.ColorSharp.Illuminants.CIE_C
member.summary: The CIE illuminant C is a (deprecated) daylight simulator intended to represent average daylight with a correlated colour temperature of 6774 K.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Illuminants.CIE_C.spectrum_Sample
member.value: 'C' expressed in its 'original form', a light spectrum.

member.name: T:Litipk.ColorSharp.Illuminants.CIE_D50
member.summary: CIE Standard Illuminant D50. Constructed to represent natural daylight at the horizon. CCT of 5003 K.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Illuminants.CIE_D50.spectrum_Sample
member.value: D50 expressed in its 'original form', a light spectrum.

member.name: T:Litipk.ColorSharp.Illuminants.CIE_D55
member.summary: CIE Standard Illuminant D55. Constructed to represent mid-morning/mid-afternoon daylight. CCT of 5503 K.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Illuminants.CIE_D55.spectrum_Sample
member.value: D50 expressed in its 'original form', a light spectrum.

member.name: T:Litipk.ColorSharp.Illuminants.CIE_D65
member.summary: CIE Standard Illuminant D65. D65 corresponds roughly to a midday sun in Western Europe / Northern Europe, hence it is also called a daylight illuminant.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Illuminants.CIE_D65.XYZ_Sample
member.value: D65 expressed as a CIE's 1931 XYZ sample (White Point).

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Illuminants.CIE_D65.xyY_Sample
member.value: D65 expressed as a CIE's 1931 xyY sample (White Point).

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Illuminants.CIE_D65.spectrum_Sample
member.value: D65 expressed in its 'original form', a light spectrum.

members.member: This gives us the wave amplitude at a given wave length, if it's necessary the method will do interpolation.
Analytic aproximations also have their confidence intervals, so there aren't exceptional cases here.
We need to know how many data points we have to make computations using all the information we have. If the concrete implementation is "analytical", then must return -1.

Preconditions : amplitudes MUST be sorted (crescent order)

member.name: T:Litipk.ColorSharp.MatchingFunctions.AMatchingFunction
member.summary: Abstract class to handle 'matching functions'. The matching functions are used to transform spectrums into simpler parametric spaces (with information loss), like CIE's 1931 XYZ color space.

member.name: M:Litipk.ColorSharp.MatchingFunctions.AMatchingFunction.EvaluateAt(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the value of the matching function for a given wave length.

member.name: M:Litipk.ColorSharp.MatchingFunctions.AMatchingFunction.GetSupportMinValue
member.summary: The matching function has a support interval. This method gives us its lower bound.

member.name: M:Litipk.ColorSharp.MatchingFunctions.AMatchingFunction.GetSupportMaxValue
member.summary: The matching function has a support interval. This method gives us its upper bound.

member.name: M:Litipk.ColorSharp.MatchingFunctions.AMatchingFunction.GetNumberOfDataPoints
member.summary: Returns us the number of data points used to construct the matching function. It returns -1 if the inner implementation is analytical and there aren't data points.

members.member: This class will be a singleton

member.name: T:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.Spd2ClrStrategy
member.summary: Enum type used to specify alternative strategies in spd->color conversion.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.Spd2ClrStrategy.WaveLength1NmStep
member.summary: Use the 1nm step matching functions to obtain the chromaticity components of the spectrum.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.Spd2ClrStrategy.WaveLength5NmStep
member.summary: Use the 5nm step matching functions to obtain the chromaticity components of the spectrum.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.Spd2ClrStrategy.TwoDegs
member.summary: Use the 2º matching functions to obtain the chromaticity components of the spectrum.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.Spd2ClrStrategy.TenDegs
member.summary: Use the 10º matching functions to obtain the chromaticity components of the spectrum.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.Spd2ClrStrategy.Nm1Deg2
member.summary: Combination of WaveLength1NmStep and TwoDegs

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.Spd2ClrStrategy.Nm5Deg2
member.summary: Combination of WaveLength5NmStep and TwoDegs

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.Spd2ClrStrategy.Nm1Deg10
member.summary: Combination of WaveLength1NmStep and TenDegs

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.Spd2ClrStrategy.Nm5Deg10
member.summary: Combination of WaveLength5NmStep and TenDegs

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.Spd2ClrStrategy.Default
member.summary: Nm5Deg2

member.name: T:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.ToSmallSpaceStrategy
member.summary: Enum type used to specify alternative strategies in color conversion.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.ToSmallSpaceStrategy.NoForce
member.summary: If the color can't be represented in the new color space, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.ToSmallSpaceStrategy.ForceLowTruncate
member.summary: "Truncates" component values in the new color space if they're lower than the new color space's lower boundaries.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.ToSmallSpaceStrategy.ForceLowStretch
member.summary: "Stretches" component values in the new color space if they're lower than the new color space's lower boundaries.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.ToSmallSpaceStrategy.ForceHighTruncate
member.summary: "Truncates" component values in the new color space if they're lower than the new color space's upper boundaries.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.ToSmallSpaceStrategy.ForceHighStretch
member.summary: "Stretches" component values in the new color space if they're lower than the new color space's upper boundaries.

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.ToSmallSpaceStrategy.ForceLow
member.summary: Combination of ForceLowStretch and ForceLowTruncate

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.ToSmallSpaceStrategy.ForceHigh
member.summary: Combination of ForceHighStretch and ForceHighTruncate

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.ToSmallSpaceStrategy.ForceTruncate
member.summary: Combination of ForceLowTruncate and ForceHighTruncate

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.ToSmallSpaceStrategy.ForceStretch
member.summary: Combination of ForceLowStretch and ForceHighStretch

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.ToSmallSpaceStrategy.Force
member.summary: Combination of ForceLow and ForceHigh

member.name: F:Litipk.ColorSharp.Strategies.ToSmallSpaceStrategy.Default
member.summary: NoForce

member.param: The name of the ship
The type of the ship (fighter, freighter, etc)

member.name: P:SpLib.Objects.ShipModuleSlot.SlotType
member.summary: Denotes power plant, gun, etc. See ShipTemplates for valid values.

member.name: P:SpLib.Objects.ShipModuleSlot.MaxLevel
member.summary: The maximum level of a module

member.name: P:SpLib.Objects.ShipModuleSlot.MinLevel
member.summary: The minimum level a module can be. Often 1.

member.name: M:SpLib.Objects.ShipModuleSlot.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a record of a given module able to be populated on a ship or template.
member.param: Desired minimum module level.
Desired maximum module level.
Desired type of slot

member.name: P:SpLib.Objects.SpaceObject.ObjectType
member.summary: Should be one of: Star, Planet, Moon, Asteroid, Comet

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.SemiMajorAxisAU
member.summary: Semi-major axis of the body's orbit in astronomical units (au).

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.Eccentricity
member.summary: Eccentricity of the body's orbit.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.AxialTiltDegrees
member.summary: Axial tilt of the planet expressed in degrees.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.OrbitZone
member.summary: Orbital zone the planet is located in. Value is 1, 2, or 3. Used in radius and volatile inventory calculations.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.OrbitalPeriodDays
member.summary: The length of the planet's year in days.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.AngularVelocityRadSec
member.summary: Angular velocity about the planet's axis in radians/sec.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.DayLengthHours
member.summary: The length of the planet's day in hours.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.HillSphereKM
member.summary: The Hill sphere of the planet expressed in km.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.MassSM
member.summary: The mass of the planet in units of Solar mass.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.DustMassSM
member.summary: The mass of dust retained by the planet (ie, the mass of the planet sans atmosphere). Given in units of Solar mass.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.GasMassSM
member.summary: The mass of gas retained by the planet (ie, the mass of its atmosphere). Given in units of Solar mass.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.EscapeVelocityCMSec
member.summary: The velocity required to escape from the body given in cm/sec.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.SurfaceAccelerationCMSec2
member.summary: The gravitational acceleration felt at the surface of the planet. Given in cm/sec^2

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.SurfaceGravityG
member.summary: The gravitational acceleration felt at the surface of the planet. Given as a fraction of Earth gravity (Gs).

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.CoreRadiusKM
member.summary: The radius of the planet's core in km.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.RadiusKM
member.summary: The radius of the planet's surface in km.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.DensityGCC
member.summary: The density of the planet given in g/cc.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.RMSVelocityCMSec
member.summary: The root-mean-square velocity of N2 at the planet's exosphere given in cm/sec. Used to determine where or not a planet is capable of retaining an atmosphere.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.MolecularWeightRetained
member.summary: The smallest molecular weight the planet is capable of retaining. I believe this is in g/mol.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.VolatileGasInventory
member.summary: Unitless value for the inventory of volatile gases that result from outgassing. Used in the calculation of surface pressure. See Fogg eq. 16.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.BoilingPointWaterKelvin
member.summary: Boiling point of water on the planet given in Kelvin.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.Albedo
member.summary: Planetary albedo. Unitless value between 0 (no reflection) and 1 (completely reflective).

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.Illumination
member.summary: Illumination received by the body at at the farthest point of its orbit. 1.0 is the amount of illumination received by an object 1 au from the Sun.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.ExosphereTempKelvin
member.summary: Temperature at the body's exosphere given in Kelvin.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.SurfaceTempKelvin
member.summary: Temperature at the body's surface given in Kelvin.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.GreenhouseRiseKelvin
member.summary: Amount (in Kelvin) that the planet's surface temperature is being increased by a runaway greenhouse effect.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.DaytimeTempKelvin
member.summary: Average daytime temperature in Kelvin.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.NighttimeTempKelvin
member.summary: Average nighttime temperature in Kelvin.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.MaxTempKelvin
member.summary: Maximum (summer/day) temperature in Kelvin.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.MinTempKelvin
member.summary: Minimum (winter/night) temperature in Kelvin.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.WaterCoverFraction
member.summary: Amount of the body's surface that is covered in water. Given as a value between 0 (no water) and 1 (completely covered).

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.CloudCoverFraction
member.summary: Amount of the body's surface that is obscured by cloud cover. Given as a value between 0 (no cloud coverage) and 1 (surface not visible at all).

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Planet.IceCoverFraction
member.summary: Amount of the body's surface that is covered in ice. Given as a value between 0 (no ice) and 1 (completely covered).

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Star.AgeYears
member.summary: Age of the star in years.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Star.Life
member.summary: The maximum lifetime of the star in years.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Star.EcosphereRadiusAU
member.summary: The distance that the star's "ecosphere" (as far as I can tell, ye olden science speak for circumstellar habitable zone) is centered on. Given in AU.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Star.Luminosity
member.summary: Luminosity of the star in solar luminosity units (L☉). The luminosity of the sun is 1.0.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Star.Mass
member.summary: Mass of the star in solar mass units (M☉). The mass of the sun is 1.0.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Star.BinaryMass
member.summary: The mass of this star's companion star (if any) in solar mass units (M☉).

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Star.SemiMajorAxisAU
member.summary: The semi-major axis of the companion star in au.

member.name: P:StarformCore.Data.Star.Eccentricity
member.summary: The eccentricity of the companion star's orbit.

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.MinimumIllumination(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the illumination of a body at its farthest point from a star.
member.param: Semi-major axis of the body in au
Luminance of the star in solar luminance units
member.returns: Illumination where 1.0 is equal to the light received by the Earth from the Sun.

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.StarEcosphereRadiusAU(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the radius (center?) of a star's ecosphere in au.
member.param: Luminosity of the star in solar luminosity units.

member.summary: Returns the hill sphere of object m orbiting object M with a semi- major axis a. Ignores eccentricity.
member.param: The mass of the larger body
The mass of the smaller body
Semi-major axis in AU

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.SimplifiedHillSphereAU(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the hill sphere of object m orbiting object M with a semi- major axis a. Ignores eccentricity.
member.param: The mass of the larger body
The mass of the smaller body
Semi-major axis in AU

member.summary: Returns the Roche limit of an object in KM
member.param: Radius of the body in km
Density of the body in g/cc
Density of the orbiting satellite in g/cc
member.returns: Roche limit for the satellite in KM

member.summary: Returns the Roche limit of an object in AU
member.param: Radius of the body in km
Density of the body in g/cc
Density of the orbiting satellite in g/cc
member.returns: Roche limit for the satellite in AU

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.Luminosity(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the luminosity of a star using the Mass-Luminosity relationship.
member.param: Mass of the star

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.IsTidallyLocked(StarformCore.Data.Planet)
member.summary: Returns true if the planet is tidally locked to its parent body.

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.IsHabitable(StarformCore.Data.Planet)
member.summary: Returns true if the planet's conditions can support human life

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.IsEarthlike(StarformCore.Data.Planet)
member.summary: Returns true if the planet's conditions are similar to Earth

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.OrbitalZone(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This function, given the orbital radius of a planet in AU, returns the orbital 'zone' of the planet.

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.VolumeRadius(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the radius of a planet.
member.param: Mass in units of solar masses
Density in units of grams/cc

member.summary: Returns the radius of the planet in kilometers.
member.param: Mass in units of solar mass
Is the planet a gas giant?
Orbital zone

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.EmpiricalDensity(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the the empirical density in grams/cc

Radius in units of AU

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.VolumeDensity(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Density returned in units of grams/cc
member.param: Mass in units of solar masses
Equatorial radius in km

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.Period(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a planet's period in Earth days

Units of solar masses
Units of solar masses

member.summary: Provides an approximation of angular velocity for non-tidally decelerated planets.

Radius of the body in km
Is the body a gas giant?

Mass of the body in solar masses
Radius of the body in KM
Semi-major axis of the body's orbit in AU

Radius of the planet in km

Is the planet a gas giant?

member.summary: Returns an approximation of a planet's angular velocity in radians/sec

member.summary: Returns the length of a planet's day in hours.
member.param: The planet's angular velocity in radians/sec
The planet's orbital period in days
The eccentricity of the planet's orbit

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.HasResonantPeriod(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Checks if a planet's rotation is in resonance with its orbit
member.param: The planet's angular velocity in radians/sec
The length of the planet's day in hours
The orbital period of the planet in days
The eccentricity of the planet's orbit
member.returns: True if the planet is in a resonant orbit

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.Inclination(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a randomized inclination in units of degrees

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.EscapeVelocity(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns escape velocity in cm/sec
member.param: Mass in units of solar mass
Radius in km

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.RMSVelocity(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the root-mean-square velocity of particles in a gas.
member.param: Mass of gas in g/mol
Temperature in K

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.MoleculeLimit(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the smallest molecular weight retained by the body, which is useful for determining atmospheric composition.
member.param: Mass in solar masses
Equatorial radius in units of kilometers

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.Acceleration(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the surface acceleration of the planet.
member.param: Mass of the planet in solar masses
Radius of the planet in km
member.returns: Acceleration returned in units of cm/sec2

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.Gravity(System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the surface gravity of a planet.
member.param: Acceleration in units of cm/sec2
member.returns: Gravity in units of Earth gravities

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.VolatileInventory(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculates the inventory of volatiles in a planet's atmosphere as a result of outgassing. This value is used to calculate the planet's surface pressure. Implements Fogg's eq. 17.
member.param: Planet mass in solar masses
Planet escape velocity in cm/sec
Planet RMS velocity in cm/sec
Mass of the planet's star in solar masses
Planet's "zone" in the system
True if the planet is experiencing a runaway greenhouse effect
True if the planet has accreted any gas

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.Pressure(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns pressure in units of millibars. This implements Fogg's eq.18.
member.param: Radius in km
Gravity in units of Earth gravities

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.BoilingPoint(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the boiling point of water using Fogg's eq.21.
member.param: Atmospheric pressure in millibars (mb)
member.returns: Boiling point of water in Kelvin.

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.HydroFraction(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: This function is Fogg's eq.22. Given the volatile gas inventory and planetary radius of a planet (in Km), this function returns the fraction of the planet covered with water.
member.param: Radius in km
member.returns: Fraction of the planet covered in water

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.CloudFraction(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the fraction of cloud cover available.

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.IceFraction(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Given the surface temperature of a planet (in Kelvin), this function returns the fraction of the planet's surface covered by ice.
member.returns: Fraction of the planet's surface covered in ice

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.EffTemp(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.param: Ecosphere radius in AU
Orbital radius in AU

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.Greenhouse(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates whether or not a planet is suffering from a runaway greenhouse effect.
member.param: Radius of the star's ecosphere in AU
Orbital radius of the planet in AU
member.returns: True if the planet is suffering a runaway greenhouse effect.

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.GreenRise(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the rise in temperature produced by the greenhouse effect.
member.param: Effective temperature in units of Kelvin

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.PlanetAlbedo(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the albedo of a planetary body.
member.param: Fraction of surface covered by water.
Fraction of planet covered by clouds.
Fraction of planet covered by ice.
Surface pressure in mb.
member.returns: Average overall albedo of the body.

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.Opacity(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the dimensionless quantity of optical depth, which is useful in determing the amount of greenhouse effect on a planet.

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.GasLife(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the number of years it takes for 1/e of a gas to escape from a planet's atmosphere
member.param: Molecular weight of the gas
Exosphere temperature of the planet in Kelvin
Surface gravity of the planet in G
Radius of the planet in km

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.MinMolecularWeight(StarformCore.Data.Planet)
member.summary: Calculates the minimum molecular weight retained by a planet

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.CalculateSurfaceTemperature(StarformCore.Data.Planet@,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: The temperature of the planet calculated in degrees Kelvin

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.InspiredPartialPressure(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Inspired partial pressure, taking into account humidification of the air in the nasal passage and throat.
member.param: Total atmospheric surface pressure in millibars
Partial gas pressure in millibars

member.name: M:StarformCore.Environment.Breathability(StarformCore.Data.Planet)
member.summary: Returns the breathability state of the planet's atmosphere.

member.name: T:StarformCore.UnitConversions
member.summary: Simple helper methods for converting between different unit types.

member.name: M:StarformCore.UnitConversions.KelvinToFahrenheit(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts temperature from Kelvin to Fahrenheit degrees.
member.param: Temperature in Kelvin

member.name: M:StarformCore.UnitConversions.MMHGToMillibars(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts pressure from mmHg to millibars
member.param: Pressure in mmHg

member.name: M:StarformCore.UnitConversions.CMToKM(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts cm to km
member.param: Units cm

member.name: M:StarformCore.UnitConversions.EarthRadiusToCentimeters(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts from units of Earth radius (R⊕) to centimeters.
member.param: Distance in Earth radius units.

member.name: M:StarformCore.UnitConversions.EarthRadiusToKilometers(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts from units of Earth radius (R⊕) to kilometers.
member.param: Distance in Earth radius units.

member.name: M:StarformCore.UnitConversions.CentimetersToEarthRadius(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts from centimeters to Earth radius units (R⊕).
member.param: Distance in centimeters
member.returns: Distance in Earth radius (1.0 = Radius of Earth)

member.name: M:StarformCore.UnitConversions.KilometersToEarthRadius(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts from kilometers to Earth radius units (R⊕).
member.returns: Distance in Earth radius (1.0 = radius of Earth)

member.name: M:StarformCore.UnitConversions.SolarMassesToEarthMasses(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts from solar masses to units of Earth mass (M⊕).
member.param: Mass in solar masses
member.returns: Mass in Earth masses (1.0 = mass of Earth)

member.name: M:StarformCore.UnitConversions.SolarMassesToKilograms(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts from units of solar mass (M☉) to kilograms.
member.param: Mass in solar masses

member.name: M:StarformCore.UnitConversions.SolarMassesToGrams(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts from units of solar mass (M☉) to grams.
member.param: Mass in solar masses

member.name: M:StarformCore.UnitConversions.MillibarsToAtm(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts pressure from millibars to atm
member.param: Pressure in millibars

member.name: M:StarformCore.UnitConversions.PPMToMillibars(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the partial pressure of an atmospheric gas in millibars from the concentration given in parts-per-million.
member.param: Concentration in parts-per-million.
Total pressure of the gas in atm (default=1)

member.name: M:StarformCore.UnitConversions.MillibarsToPPM(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Converts partial pressure in millibars to PPM at a specific atmospheric pressure.
member.param: Gas partial pressure in millibars
Atmospheric pressure in atm
